snippet: Corporate profits are far bigger now than they were in 1977, the year Apple was incorporated and corporate tax rates have fallen.
An inquest has brought forth details of the death in August 2010 of Gareth Williams, who was found locked in a duffel bag in a bathtub.
abstract: Official inquest by British government into the 2010 death of Gareth Williams, a rising star in MI6's supersecret counterterrorism work, appears to bolster theories that Williams died as a result of a sex game gone wrong; agency believes there is no connection between Williams's spy work and his death but has made no official ruling.

headline.main: Death of Spy, Zipped Into Bag, Spawns Theories and Inquest
headline.print_headline: Death of Spy, Zipped Into Bag, Spawns Theories and Inquest

snippet: The Giants’ first-round draft pick, running back David Wilson, was known on the Virginia Tech campus for his gregarious nature, his attire and his ability to break tackles.
abstract: New York Giants first-round draft pick, running back David Wilson, is known on the Virginia Tech campus for his gregarious nature, his attire and his ability to break tackles.

headline.main: Giants Find Big-Play Potential and Smile With Pick
headline.print_headline: Giants Find Big-Play Potential And Smile With Top Pick

snippet: The technology industry is working on viewing options that could include apps, a move that has the potential to transform cable television’s interface and business model.
abstract: Technology industry is working to upgrade television's outdated channel-clicking interface to mimic tablet computers; trend has alarmed cable providers, as it may allow viewers to forgo traditional subscriptions in favor of streaming a la carte program choices.

headline.main: In Search of Apps for Television

byline.original: By AMY CHOZICK and NICK WINGFIELD

snippet: Google's Android is installed on more devices than any other mobile software system in the world. But one prominent IT consulting firm says its prominence is eroding in the smartphone market in the United States.
abstract: Google's Android is installed on more devices than any other mobile software system in the world. But one prominent IT consulting firm says its prominence is eroding in the smartphone market in the United States.

headline.main: Android Is Failing to Get Into Businesses as iPhone and iPad Do

snippet: With the colorful Marlins Park in Miami, baseball has broken from the now-familiar retro style into the 21st century.
abstract: Michael Kimmelman reviews Marlins Park, new home field of baseball's Miami Marlins and the first unapologetic 21st-century stadium after two decades of retro-style ballparks; notes that ballpark is unlikely to satisfy aficionados of the latest trends in architecture, but says it offers genuine panache and a style that truly reflects its colorful hometown.

headline.main: A Ballpark That May Be Louder Than the Fans
headline.print_headline: A Ballpark That May Be Louder Than the Fans

snippet: Standard & Poor’s dropped the company’s bond rating to junk status and lowered its outlook for the Finnish handset maker following low sales of its smartphones.
abstract: Standard & Poor’s dropped the company’s bond rating to junk status and lowered its outlook for the Finnish handset maker following low sales of its smartphones.

headline.main: S.&P. Downgrades Nokia's Bonds to Junk
headline.print_headline: S.&P. Downgrades Nokia’s Bonds to Junk

keywords.value: Credit Ratings and Credit Rating Agencies

snippet: The South Korean company reported a quarterly profit of $5.15 billion as it prepared for the release of its new Galaxy S phone.

headline.print_headline: Samsung Posts Record Profit, Helped by Handset Sales

snippet: Manufacturers have reported weak performances in the first quarter as economic growth has slowed nearly to a three-year low.

headline.print_headline: China's Economic Slowdown Has Hurt Global Manufacturers

snippet: A selected guide to events for, by and about children, teenagers and families.

headline.main: Spare Times: For Children, for April 27 — May 3
